texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I received an e-mail from  Tim Linden  about a  post he made in his blog  about backing up MySQL data to  Amazon's S3 .
texts.text: I received an e-mail from  Tim Linden  about a  post he made in his blog  about backing up MySQL data to  Amazon's S3 .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The article goes over installing the Net::Amazon::S3 Perl module via WHM (which is handy for the cPanel users). However, if you're not a cPanel user, you can install it via CPAN:
texts.text: The article goes over installing the Net::Amazon::S3 Perl module via WHM (which is handy for the cPanel users). However, if you're not a cPanel user, you can install it via CPAN:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you'd rather install it through Webmin, go to the 'Others' section, and click 'Perl Modules'.
texts.text: If you'd rather install it through Webmin, go to the 'Others' section, and click 'Perl Modules'.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Also, Tim mentions configuring a  Firefox extension for accessing S3  that works very well. However, I find myself using Safari most often, so I prefer to use  Jungle Disk  or  Transmit  on my Mac.
texts.text: Also, Tim mentions configuring a  Firefox extension for accessing S3  that works very well. However, I find myself using Safari most often, so I prefer to use  Jungle Disk  or  Transmit  on my Mac.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Overall, it's a great post, and I'm glad Tim told me about it!
texts.text: Overall, it's a great post, and I'm glad Tim told me about it!
